comment: Dr. McLester has been the best professor I have ever taken hands down. He is deliberate about the content necessary for learning while making it a blast to learn. He has exemplified what it means to be an effective communicator, personable during lectures, and just a genuine human being. He cuts out A LOT of busy work and is a "player's coach"

Graded by 3 tests only. If you are not a good test taker/ have test anxiety, it will be a struggle. He does a study guide review day that is helpful. Otherwise listen to lectures carefully to get the answers to the study guide/course content as he sprinkles in course content with his stories and mythbusters videos. Does not use P.P. to lecture.

I took Dr. McLester for biomech and ex phys 2, and he is the kind of professor that the world needs more of! He genuinely cares about you and wants you to succeed. He takes letter grains with a a grain of salt and analyzes all of his tests to make sure that they are truly fair. If I could take him for every class, I would!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: I LOVED Dr. McLester! He is one of those professors who genuinely wants their students to succeed in all aspects of life, not just school. Biomechanics is 3 tests, but they are easy if you do the study guide. I would definitely take him again. He lectures with no powerpoints, just speaking, but you won't miss anything as long as you ask questions!

Dr. McLester was my favorite professor @ KSU! 10/10 recommend you take him for biomechanics, Ex Phys 1 & 2. I learned so much from him and really enjoyed all of his classes. He genuinely cares about his students not only in class but outside the classroom as well. If I could go back and do college over again I would take him for every single class

Really funny guy who makes class entertaining. Only grades are 3 tests but the tests come straight from the study guide and he will give you the answers to the study guide in class the period before the test if you ask for them. He's super understanding and a good lecturer. Don't need the book. Gives good life advice as well.

Great professor. He's very enthusiastic and upbeat. The class isn't anything difficult, but it definitely requires studying. I didn't buy or use the book and still got an A. He provides study guides that are very similar to the tests.
